channel.title: Posts on Kieran Strawmier Code Work
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Kieran Strawmier Code Work

item.title: on september 3, 2019 the mets lost all playoff hopes.
item.description: full gamee view for correct size reference before I zoom into the ninth. I want to add more % on the y axis to see the change. Cabera and Zimmerman mess with my sizing. plot_grid(bar1,bar2, ncol=1) leaguepitch <- bref_daily_pitcher("2019-03-20", "2019-10-30") %>% filter(IP >=50) metspitchingstaff <- c("Luis Avilan","Tyler Bashlor","Brad Brach","Jacob deGrom","Edwin Diaz","Jeurys Familia","Chris Flexen","Wilmer Font","Drew Gagnon","Robert Gsellman","Donnie Hart","Walker Lockett","Seth Lugo","Steven Matz","Chris Mazza","Stephen Nogosek","Ryan O'Rourke","Corey Oswalt","Tim Peterson","Brooks Pounders","Jacob Rhame","Hector Santiago","Paul Sewald","Marcus Stroman","Noah Syndergaard","Jason Vargas","Zack Wheeler","Justin Wilson","Daniel Zamora") metspitch <- bref_daily_pitcher("2019-03-20", "2019-10-30") %>% filter(Name %in% metspitchingstaff) jv <- leaguepitch %>% filter(Name == "Justin Verlander") jh <- leaguepitch %>% filter(Name == "Josh Hader") Luis Avil√°n only pitched 32 innings and for 1 batting in this inning so he wont be shown

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.
